   733→    slugs:
   734→      - task-automation-eligibility
   735→    title: Task Automation Eligibility
   736→    type: requirement
   737→    tags: []
   738→    depends_on: []
   739→    implements: []
   740→    relates_to: []
   741→    tests: []
   742→    notes: []
   743→    created: 2026-01-19T19:23:47.591Z
   744→    description: Tasks have an automation eligibility status that indicates whether they can be
   745→      processed by unattended automation loops (like ralph). Eligibility is determined by human
   746→      judgment during triage - assessing whether the task is unambiguous, appropriately scoped, and
   747→      has sufficient context (spec + notes + description) to be standalone. This prevents automation
   748→      from attempting tasks that require human decisions, clarification, or oversight.
   749→    acceptance_criteria:
   750→      - id: ac-1
   751→        given: a task exists
   752→        when: checking its schema
   753→        then: "it has an optional automation field with enum values: eligible, needs_review, manual_only"
   754→      - id: ac-2
   755→        given: a new task is created
   756→        when: no automation value is specified
   757→        then: the task has no automation field (treated as unassessed)
   758→      - id: ac-3
   759→        given: ralph is selecting tasks
   760→        when: filtering ready tasks
   761→        then: "only tasks with automation: eligible are presented to the agent"
   762→      - id: ac-4
   763→        given: an agent is working on an eligible task
   764→        when: the agent determines the task is not suitable for automation
   765→        then: the agent marks it as needs_review and adds a note explaining why (note is required)
   766→      - id: ac-5
   767→        given: a human is triaging tasks
   768→        when: assessing automation readiness
   769→        then: they can set automation to any value (eligible, needs_review, manual_only) or clear it
   770→      - id: ac-6
   771→        given: a task is marked needs_review
   772→        when: it needs to become eligible again
   773→        then: "a human must review and explicitly set automation: eligible"
   774→      - id: ac-7
   775→        given: ralph is selecting tasks
   776→        when: a task has no automation field (unassessed)
   777→        then: that task is not presented to the agent
   778→      - id: ac-8
   779→        given: ralph is selecting tasks
   780→        when: "a task has automation: needs_review"
   781→        then: that task is not presented to the agent
   782→      - id: ac-9
   783→        given: ralph is selecting tasks
   784→        when: "a task has automation: manual_only"
   785→        then: that task is not presented to the agent
   786→      - id: ac-10
   787→        given: ralph is running
   788→        when: "no tasks with automation: eligible exist in ready state"
   789→        then: ralph exits with a message indicating no eligible tasks available
   790→      - id: ac-11
   791→        given: a user wants to set automation status
   792→        when: running kspec task set @ref --automation eligible
   793→        then: the task's automation field is set to the specified value
   794→      - id: ac-12
   795→        given: a user wants to clear automation status
   796→        when: running kspec task set @ref --no-automation
   797→        then: the task's automation field is removed (returns to unassessed state)
   798→      - id: ac-13
   799→        given: a task is created via kspec task add
   800→        when: the --automation flag is provided
   801→        then: the task is created with the specified automation value
   802→      - id: ac-14
   803→        given: kspec tasks ready is run
   804→        when: displaying the ready tasks list
   805→        then: the automation status is shown for each task (showing 'unassessed' if not set)
   806→      - id: ac-15
   807→        given: a task is marked manual_only
   808→        when: it needs to become eligible
   809→        then: "a human must review and explicitly set automation: eligible"
   810→      - id: ac-16
   811→        given: an agent marks a task as needs_review during a ralph iteration
   812→        when: the marking is complete
   813→        then: the agent moves on to the next eligible task (does not exit the loop)
   814→      - id: ac-17
   815→        given: kspec task get @ref is run
   816→        when: displaying task details
   817→        then: the automation status is shown (or 'unassessed' if not set)
   818→      - id: ac-18
   819→        given: an agent or human marks a task as needs_review
   820→        when: setting the status
   821→        then: a note explaining why the task needs review is required (either via --reason or separate task
   822→          note command)
   823→      - id: ac-19
   824→        given: kspec tasks ready is run
   825→        when: the --eligible flag is provided
   826→        then: "only tasks with automation: eligible are shown"
   827→      - id: ac-20
   828→        given: kspec tasks ready is run
   829→        when: the --unassessed flag is provided
   830→        then: only tasks without an automation field are shown
   831→      - id: ac-21
   832→        given: kspec validate is run
   833→        when: "a task has automation: eligible but no spec_ref"
   834→        then: a warning (not error) is emitted suggesting eligible tasks should have linked specs;
   835→          validation still passes
   836→      - id: ac-22
   837→        given: a task's automation status needs to change
   838→        when: considering valid transitions
   839→        then: any status can transition to any other status, but transitions TO eligible require human
   840→          action (agents cannot mark tasks eligible)
   841→      - id: ac-23
   842→        given: "a task has automation: eligible"
   843→        when: its spec_ref is removed or the referenced spec is deleted
   844→        then: the automation status is preserved but kspec validate emits a warning
   845→      - id: ac-24
   846→        given: kspec tasks ready is run
   847→        when: the --needs-review flag is provided
   848→        then: "only tasks with automation: needs_review are shown (for human triage)"
   849→      - id: ac-25
   850→        given: ralph starts a new loop iteration
   851→        when: selecting the next task
   852→        then: "ralph re-reads task list and filters by automation: eligible (reflecting any status changes
   853→          from previous iterations)"
   854→    status:
   855→      maturity: draft
   856→      implementation: not_started
   857→
